txt.en: The trail of Orc prints continue through the rocky terrain of Taur Drúadan
The prints lead into a large encampment of the Enemy in northern Taur Drúadan
You notice a ring of crudely shaped keys tethered to the warden's waist
Shákrug's quarters are locked from the inside. Someone else at the encampment must have a key
The Mordor Key-warden is located in Maudhúl Grak.\n\nYou should defeat the Mordor Key-warden.
<rgb=#FF0000>Look Around</rgb> for any clues as to Shákrug's whereabouts
<rgb=#FF0000>Look Around</rgb> for any clues as to Shákrug's whereabouts
The spot where Bhai-buri-Ghân was killed can be found east of Amon Dîn, outside of the Drúadan Forest.\n\nYou should hike to the place where Bhai-buri-Ghân was killed by Shákrug.
You should follow the Orc prints to see where they lead.
Ghân-buri-Ghân, chief of the Drúedain, asks of you to slay the Orc, Shákrug, in retribution for the death of Ghân-buri-Ghân's son, Bhai-buri-Ghân.
Follow the Orc prints to see where they lead
Maudhúl Grak can be found in northern Taur Drúadan.\n\nYou should find Shákrug's stronghold in Maudhúl Grak.
This must be the place where Bhai-buri-Ghân was killed
There was certainly a sign of conflict here. You notice Orc tracks leading west

'Stranger, you come to our village in a terrible time. Our greatest foes, you call Orcs, threaten us. Our Okwô-kuryô statues ward them away but our numbers dwindle.\n\n'Our spirit, not as wide as once was. My son, Bhai-buri-Ghân, slain by these evil beasts. Shákrug is to blame, leads Orcs. Find, kill, bring me Shákrug's head. No more Drúedain may die by hand of Shákrug.'
